questions.question: TfL believes it is important to provide a public transport system which

Is most expensive in the world

questions.answer: All people can use, so that older and disabled people have the same opportunities to travel as all other people

questions.question: Which scenarios are an example of an adult at risk? (2 correct answers)
options: An adult who seems to be controlled by someone else or is having decisions made for them by another adult
An adult who is constantly on his phone during the journey
An adult who seems to have their money controlled by someone else
answer: An adult who seems to be controlled by someone else or is having decisions made for them by another adult
An adult who seems to have their money controlled by someone else

questions.question: As a driver it is important to: (2 correct answers)
options: Be aware of children and adults at risk and be concerned about their well being

Listen to what adults and children at risk tell you and reassure them by being professional, kind and considerate
answer: Be aware of children and adults at risk and be concerned about their well being
Listen to what adults and children at risk tell you and reassure them by being professional, kind and considerate

questions.question: What may happen if a serious complaint is made against you or there are number of complaints, or there appears to be a pattern of poor behaviour and all the ways to improve your behaviour have been tried but have failed?
options: TfL will report you to the DVLA and your driving licence may be revoked
TfL may have to suspend or revoke your licence
TfL has no powers to take any action
questions.answer: TfL may have to suspend or revoke your licence

questions.question: If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within?
options: TfL must have both your mobile and landline phone numbers.
You do not have to tell TfL if your home address changes.
You should tell TfL if your email address or telephone number changes
questions.answer: You should tell TfL if your email address or telephone number changes

questions.answer: Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle

questions.question: Do operators need to keep details of complaints made to them?
options: Yes, but only details of complaints involving violent or aggressive behaviour

questions.question: To help passengers who have a problem hearing or passengers who do not speak much English?
options: Always have a pen and paper with you so that you can write things down
Drop them off at the nearest bus stop

questions.answer: Always have a pen and paper with you so that you can write things down

questions.question: If a road marking says Taxis?

questions.question: What can you expect when someone has taken drugs or alcohol?
options: It can make it difficult for them to think clearly or communicate properly, and it can also affect both. In certain cases, they might act violently.
questions.answer: It can make it difficult for them to think clearly or communicate properly, and it can also affect both. In certain cases, they might act violently.

questions.question: If the passenger cannot communicate clearly to confirm their destination, or is unable to walk because of drink or drugs
options: You must take them free of charge to the nearest hospital
You have the right to refuse to take them in your vehicle
You must report it to the police
questions.answer: You have the right to refuse to take them in your vehicle

questions.question: If necessary, find somewhere safe to stop the vehicle, turn off the engine, take the keys then get out of the vehicle. If the passenger is planning to hurt you, they will probably get out of the vehicle too. This gives you the opportunity to quickly get back in and lock the doors then drive away if it is safe to do so. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: If necessary, then don't find somewhere safe to stop the vehicle, turn off the engine, take the keys then get out of the vehicle.
If necessary, choose a secure location to stop the car, turn off the ignition, take the keys, and exit the vehicle.

questions.answer: If necessary, choose a secure location to stop the car, turn off the ignition, take the keys, and exit the vehicle.

questions.question: If there are waiting or parking restrictions, what can you do?
options: You can stop for up to 5 minutes
You can stop for no longer than is needed for the passenger to get in or out of the vehicle

questions.answer: You can stop for no longer than is needed for the passenger to get in or out of the vehicle

options: You have no authority to turn away passengers.

You cannot do this because you cannot be sure that they have given you the correct address or that they will be able to get out of your vehicle without help.
questions.answer: You can do this since you can't be certain that they gave you the right address or that they will be able to exit your car without assistance.
